meanings.definition: To persuade someone to do something through charm or temptation.
meanings.sent1: She was seducing him with her sweet smile.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys seducing people with his clever words.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat was seducing the dog into playing chase.
meanings.sent4: The hypnotic melody was seducing everyone to the dance floor.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked cookies was seducing her to the kitchen.

meanings.definition: To attract someone to engage in a romantic or sexual relationship.
meanings.sent1: The romantic movie was seducing them to hold hands.
meanings.sent2: The charming music was seducing couples to dance together.
meanings.sent3: The love potion was seducing people left and right.
meanings.sent4: The moonlight was seducing lovers to share a kiss.
meanings.sent5: The cozy fireplace was seducing them to cuddle closer.

meanings.sent1: The tempting offer was seducing him to take a risk.
meanings.sent2: The mysterious stranger was seducing her into an adventure.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was seducing the birds away from the feeder.
meanings.sent4: The forbidden fruit was seducing Eve into disobedience.
meanings.sent5: The bright lights of the city were seducing him away from his quiet village.
